channel.title: Dudeofthed's Basic Guide to BBCode
channel.description:
[list][list]+----------------------------------------------+ | Dudeofthed guide to bbcode------------------| | Version: 0.99---------------------------------| +----------------------------------------------+ If you want to BBCode and you don't know how then follow this guide. In this Tutorial you will learn how to: [ul]- Add Bold Text - Add Underlined Text - Add Italic Text - Add Images - Add a List - Change Text Color - Change the Font Size - Add URL's (Named URL's, Direct Link URL's and more...) - Use Quotes - Center Text - Resize Images - Computer Code Font - Change the Text Font[/ul] Dudeofthed's basic guide to BBCode offers Step-By-Step guides, F.A.Q and more. This guide is so simple even the Kindergarten's (That can read) could understand. There may be some technical words in this guide that you will not be able to understand so that is why I have added a contents. The words in [b]Bold and RoyalBlue Color[/b] can be found in the contents. Also, if you find a "." between any tags that means it is just an example to show the tags, remove the "." when trying to add that tag to your post. To continue please scroll down until you will see the hyphens (---). ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [size=15pt][b]Page 1: Adding Underlined, Bold and Italic Text[/b][/size] You can make [b]Bold[/b], [i]Italicized[/i] and [u]Underlined[/u] Text by adding some [b]tags[/b] around the text you would like to [b]modify[/b]. To add Underlined text just add a "[.u]" [b]tag[/b] before the sentence or word then after the sentence or word add a "[./u]" [b]tag[/b] to underline the sentence or word. Example: [u]This is Underline Text[/u] To add Bold text just add a "[.b]" [b]tag[/b] before the sentence or word then add a "[./b]" [b]tag[/b] after the sentence or word to bold the sentence or word. Example: [b]This is Bold Text[/b] To add Italic text just add a "[.i]" [b]tag[/b] before the sentence then add a "[./i]" [b]tag[/b] after the sentence to Italicize the sentence or word. Example: [i]This is Italic Text[/i] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [size=15pt][b]Page 2: Adding Images and Resizing them[/b][/size] You can add Images and [b]Resize[/b] them to. To add an image, enter the [b]tag[/b] "[.img]" then after it add the link to your image. Then after the link to the image add a "[./img]" [b]tag[/b]. Example: [img]http://img258.imageshack.us/img258/5465/uni8xx.png[/img] To [b]Resize[/b] an image enter the [b]tag[/b] "[.img=[b]X[/b]x[b]X[/b]]" (Replace the [b]X[/b] with a number) then after that [b]tag[/b] add the link to your image. Then after the link to the image add a "[./img]" [b]tag[/b]. Example: [img=52x53]http://img258.imageshack.us/img258/5465/uni8xx.png[/img] (This forum will not allow you to resize an image). ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [size=15pt][b]Page 3: Adding Lists[/b][/size] You can add numbered lists and bulleted lists. Let's start with the numbered list first. To be able to [b]create[/b] lists. Enter the [b]tag[/b] "[.list=]" and then use the "[.*]" [b]tag[/b] then enter a sentence or word. Press the Enter/Return key and enter the "[.*]" [b]tag[/b] before the sentence or word. Continue this [b]process[/b] until you're happy with your list. When you want to finish enter the "[./list]" [b]tag[/b] and you're done. Example: [ul][*] This is a list[*] This is another list[*] This is another another list[/ul] To make an [b]ordered[/b] list just do the above except [b]rename[/b] the "[.list]" [b]tag[/b] with this "[.list=1]" [b]tag[/b] to make it go in [b]numerical[/b] order. If you want alphebetical order, [b]rename[/b] the "[.list=1]" [b]tag[/b] with the "[.list=a]" [b]tag[/b]. Do not [b]rename[/b] the "[./list]" [b]tag[/b] as it [b]remains[/b] the same. Example: [ul][*]This is an ordered list [*]This is another ordered list [*]This is another another ordered list[/ul] And another style of an ordered list: [ul][*] This is a style of another ordered list[*] The alphebetical ordered list[/ul] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [size=15pt][b]Page 4: Changing the Text Color and the Font Size[/b][/size] BBCode [b]allows[/b] you to change the Text color and the Font Size too. To change the font size enter the "[.size=[b]X[/b]]" [b]tag[/b]. Replace the "[b]X[/b]" with a number. Enter a word or sentence after the size [b]tag[/b] then at the end of those word or sentence add a "[./size]" [b]tag[/b]. Example: [size=10]Size 10[/size] [size=11]Size 11[/size] [size=12]Size 12 (Normal Size)[/size] [size=14]Size 14[/size] To change the font color enter the "[.color=[b]XXXXXX[/b]]" [b]tag[/b] but [b]rename[/b] the "[b]XXXXXX[/b]" with the color name or color [b]HEX Code[/b] (You can find a list of the color [b]HEX Codes[/b] and color names at the end of the Tutorial). Then after that [b]tag[/b] enter the sentence or word and after the sentence or word you want colored enter the "[./color]" [b]tag[/b] and the end of the sentence. Example: #7FFF00 HEX Code (You can find the ColorNames on Page 8) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [size=15pt][b]Page 5: Adding URL's[/b][/size] URL's are links that open up into a new page to visit another website. To add a URL, enter the "[.url]" [b]tag[/b] then the link, after the link enter the "[./url]" [b]tag[/b] to make a URL. Example: [url=http://www.bubble-struggle.com/]http://www.bubble-struggle.com/[/url] To name a URL enter the "[.url=[b]http://www.XXXXXXXXXX.com/[/b]]" and [b]rename[/b] the "[b]http://www.XXXXXXXXXX.com/[/b]" with a website address. After the "]" [b]symbol[/b] enter a name you want to call the website. After the name or sentence enter the "[./url]" [b]tag[/b] to make a named URL. Example: [url=http://www.bubble-struggle.com/]Click Here to play Bubble Struggle[/url] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [size=15pt][b]Page 6: Using quotes[/b][/size] Quotes are a text that somebody else has written. Or it is text in a white box. To quote enter the "[.quote]" [b]tag[/b] then a block of text. After the text enter the "[./quote]" [b]tag[/b] to make a quote. Example:
This is a quote
To Quote somebody else enter the "[.quote="[b]XXXXXX[/b]"]" [b]tag[/b] but [b]rename[/b] the "[b]XXXXXX[/b]" with a name. After the "]" [b]symbol[/b] enter a block of text. After that block of text enter the "[./quote]" [b]tag[/b] to make a named quote. Example:
Come and play Bubble Struggle. It is very fun.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [size=15pt][b]Page 7: Centering the Text, Changing Text font and Using Computer Code Font[/b][/size] In some forums you can center the text and change the font. But all forums (For Sure) will allow you to use the Computer Code Font. So let's get started with that first shall we. To use computer code font enter the "[.code]" [b]tag[/b] with a block of text after it. After the block of text enter the "[./code]" [b]tag[/b] to make some Computer Code Font. Example: [code]This is Computer Code Font[/code] To Center some text enter the "[.center]" [b]tag[/b] then enter a sentence or a word. After entering a sentence or word enter the "[./center]" [b]tag[/b] to center your text. Example: [center] This is centered text [/center] (This forums does not allow you to center your text) To change the Font, enter the "[.font=[b]XXXXX[/b]]" [b]tag[/b] but [b]rename[/b] the "[b]XXXXX[/b]" with a font name. Then after the "]" [b]symbol[/b] enter a block of text. After the block of text enter "[./font]" [b]tag[/b]. Example: [font=courier]This is Courier Font[/font] (This forums does not allow you to change the the font of your text) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [size=15pt][b]Page 8: Color Names[/b][/size] [b]Color Name[/b] Aqua AquaMarine Beige Bisque Black BlanchedAlmond Blue BlueViolet Brown BurlyWood CadetBlue Chartreuse Chocolate Coral CornflowerBlue Cornsilk Crimson Cyan DarkBlue DarkCyan DarkGoldenRod DarkGray DarkGrey DarkGreen DarkKhaki DarkMagenta DarkOliveGreen Darkorange DarkOrchid DarkRed DarkSalmon DarkSeaGreen DarkSlateBlue DarkSlateGray DarkSlateGrey DarkViolet DeepPink DeepSkyBlue DimGray DimGrey DodgerBlue FireBrick FloralWhite ForestGreen Fuchsia Gainsboro GhostWhite Gold GoldenRod Gray Grey Green GreenYellow HoneyDew HotPink IndianRed Indigo Ivory Khaki Lavender LavenderBlush LawnGreen LemonChiffon LightBlue LightCoral LightCyan LightGoldenRodYellow LightGray LightGrey LightGreen LightPink LightSalmon LightSeaGreen LightSkyBlue LightSlateGray LightSlateGrey LightSteelBlue LightYellow Lime LimeGreen Linen Magenta Maroon MediumAquaMarine MediumBlue MediumOrchid MediumPurple MediumSeaGreen MediumSlateBlue MediumSpringGreen MediumTurguoise MediumVioletRed MidnightBlue MintCream MistyRose Moccasin NavajoWhite Navy OldLace Olive OliveDrab Orange OrangeRed Orchid PaleGoldenRod PaleGreen PaleTurguoise PaleVioletRed PapayaWhip PeachPuff Peru Pink Plum PowderBlue Purple Red RosyBrown RoyalBlue SaddleBrown Salmon SandyBrown SeaGreen SeaShell Sienna Silver SkyBlue SlateBlue SlateGray SlateGrey Snow SpringGreen StealBlue Tan Teal Tistle Tomato Turguoise Violet Wheat White WhiteSmoke Yellow YellowGreen All the color names i got off [url=http://w3schools.com/html/html_colornames.asp]W3Schools.com[/url] so give them all the credit. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [size=15pt][b]Page 9: Frequently Asked Questions (F.A.Q)[/b][/size] These are some Questions mainly asked. Q: Why don't some BBCode Tags work. A: There are some Tags that some Forums do not support. Or the administrator has disabled those tags. Q: When i post a "[/[b]XXX[/b]]" or "[[b]XXX[/b]]" tag appears. A: You may have not put a start tag or end tag. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [size=15pt][b]Page 10: Contents[/b][/size] [b]Tag:[/b] A 'tag' is used for marking-up text in various ways. [b]Resize:[/b] Changing the size of something. [b]Rename:[/b] To change a word. [b]Symbol:[/b] A weird looking letter/number. [b]HEX Codes:[/b] A code for colors. [b]Process:[/b] A sequence. [b]Remain:[/b] To Stay. [b]Modify:[/b] To change. [b]Numerical:[/b] Numbered [b]Ordered:[/b] In order. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [size=15pt][b]Page 11: Credits[/b][/size] Thank-you for reading Dudeofthed's Basic Guide to BBCode. You may download the source of this topic and you can post it on other forums, but you must have my permission. [b]Special Thanks:[/b] Kresemir Cvtoniac - For making [url=http://"http://www.bubble-struggle.com/"][i]Bubble Struggle[/i][/url] and for making his forums which made me get into BBCoding. And that's all... Also thank you for posting it on other forums too, you people: [i](I will add your name's when you email me the Thread Link)[/i] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [size=15pt][b]Page 12: Other Notes[/b][/size] Sticky Please!

item.title: Dudeofthed's Basic Guide to BBCode
item.dc:creator: @dudeofthed dudeofthed
item.description:
@dudeofthed wrote:

[list][list]±---------------------------------------------+
| Dudeofthed guide to bbcode------------------|
| Version: 0.99---------------------------------|
±---------------------------------------------+

If you want to BBCode and you don’t know how then follow this guide.

In this Tutorial you will learn how to:
[ul]- Add Bold Text

  • Add Underlined Text
  • Add Italic Text
  • Add Images
  • Add a List
  • Change Text Color
  • Change the Font Size
  • Add URL’s (Named URL’s, Direct Link URL’s and more…)
  • Use Quotes
  • Center Text
  • Resize Images
  • Computer Code Font
  • Change the Text Font[/ul]

Dudeofthed’s basic guide to BBCode offers Step-By-Step guides, F.A.Q and more. This guide is so simple even the Kindergarten’s (That can read) could understand. There may be some technical words in this guide that you will not be able to understand so that is why I have added a contents.
The words in Bold and RoyalBlue Color can be found in the contents.

Also, if you find a “.” between any tags that means it is just an example to show the tags, remove the “.” when trying to add that tag to your post.

To continue please scroll down until you will see the hyphens (—).

[size=15pt]Page 1: Adding Underlined, Bold and Italic Text[/size]

You can make Bold, Italicized and Underlined Text by adding some tags around the text you would like to modify.

To add Underlined text just add a “[.u]” tag before the sentence or word then after the sentence or word add a “[./u]” tag to underline the sentence or word.
Example:
This is Underline Text

To add Bold text just add a “[.b]” tag before the sentence or word then add a “[./b]” tag after the sentence or word to bold the sentence or word.
Example:
This is Bold Text

To add Italic text just add a “[.i]” tag before the sentence then add a “[./i]” tag after the sentence to Italicize the sentence or word.
Example:
This is Italic Text

[size=15pt]Page 2: Adding Images and Resizing them[/size]

You can add Images and Resize them to.

To add an image, enter the tag “[.img]” then after it add the link to your image. Then after the link to the image add a “[./img]” tag.
Example:

To Resize an image enter the tag “[.img=XxX]” (Replace the X with a number) then after that tag add the link to your image. Then after the link to the image add a “[./img]” tag.
Example:
(This forum will not allow you to resize an image).

[size=15pt]Page 3: Adding Lists[/size]

You can add numbered lists and bulleted lists. Let’s start with the numbered list first.

To be able to create lists. Enter the tag “[.list=]” and then use the “[.]" tag then enter a sentence or word. Press the Enter/Return key and enter the "[.]” tag before the sentence or word. Continue this process until you’re happy with your list. When you want to finish enter the “[./list]” tag and you’re done.
Example:
[ul][] This is a list[] This is another list[*] This is another another list[/ul]

To make an ordered list just do the above except rename the “[.list]” tag with this “[.list=1]” tag to make it go in numerical order. If you want alphebetical order, rename the “[.list=1]” tag with the “[.list=a]” tag. Do not rename the “[./list]” tag as it remains the same.
Example:
[ul][]This is an ordered list []This is another ordered list [*]This is another another ordered list[/ul]

And another style of an ordered list:
[ul][] This is a style of another ordered list[] The alphebetical ordered list[/ul]

[size=15pt]Page 4: Changing the Text Color and the Font Size[/size]

BBCode allows you to change the Text color and the Font Size too.

To change the font size enter the “[.size=X]” tag. Replace the “X” with a number. Enter a word or sentence after the size tag then at the end of those word or sentence add a “[./size]” tag.
Example:
[size=10]Size 10[/size]
[size=11]Size 11[/size]
[size=12]Size 12 (Normal Size)[/size]
[size=14]Size 14[/size]

To change the font color enter the “[.color=XXXXXX]” tag but rename the “XXXXXX” with the color name or color HEX Code (You can find a list of the color HEX Codes and color names at the end of the Tutorial). Then after that tag enter the sentence or word and after the sentence or word you want colored enter the “[./color]” tag and the end of the sentence.
Example:
#7FFF00 HEX Code (You can find the ColorNames on Page 8)

[size=15pt]Page 5: Adding URL’s[/size]

URL’s are links that open up into a new page to visit another website.

To add a URL, enter the “[.url]” tag then the link, after the link enter the “[./url]” tag to make a URL.
Example:
http://www.bubble-struggle.com/

To name a URL enter the “[.url=http://www.XXXXXXXXXX.com/]” and rename the “http://www.XXXXXXXXXX.com/” with a website address. After the “]” symbol enter a name you want to call the website. After the name or sentence enter the “[./url]” tag to make a named URL.
Example:
Click Here to play Bubble Struggle

[size=15pt]Page 6: Using quotes[/size]

Quotes are a text that somebody else has written. Or it is text in a white box.

To quote enter the “[.quote]” tag then a block of text. After the text enter the “[./quote]” tag to make a quote.
Example:

This is a quote

To Quote somebody else enter the “[.quote=“XXXXXX”]” tag but rename the “XXXXXX” with a name. After the “]” symbol enter a block of text. After that block of text enter the “[./quote]” tag to make a named quote.
Example:

Come and play Bubble Struggle. It is very fun.

[size=15pt]Page 7: Centering the Text, Changing Text font and Using Computer Code Font[/size]

In some forums you can center the text and change the font. But all forums (For Sure) will allow you to use the Computer Code Font. So let’s get started with that first shall we.

To use computer code font enter the “[.code]” tag with a block of text after it. After the block of text enter the “[./code]” tag to make some Computer Code Font.
Example:

This is Computer Code Font

To Center some text enter the “[.center]” tag then enter a sentence or a word. After entering a sentence or word enter the “[./center]” tag to center your text.
Example:
[center] This is centered text [/center] (This forums does not allow you to center your text)

To change the Font, enter the “[.font=XXXXX]” tag but rename the “XXXXX” with a font name. Then after the “]” symbol enter a block of text. After the block of text enter “[./font]” tag.
Example:
[font=courier]This is Courier Font[/font] (This forums does not allow you to change the the font of your text)

[size=15pt]Page 8: Color Names[/size]

Color Name
Aqua
AquaMarine
Beige
Bisque
Black
BlanchedAlmond
Blue
BlueViolet
Brown
BurlyWood
CadetBlue
Chartreuse

[size=15pt]Page 9: Frequently Asked Questions (F.A.Q)[/size]

These are some Questions mainly asked.

Q: Why don’t some BBCode Tags work.
A: There are some Tags that some Forums do not support. Or the administrator has disabled those tags.

Q: When i post a “[/XXX]” or “[XXX]” tag appears.
A: You may have not put a start tag or end tag.

[size=15pt]Page 10: Contents[/size]

Tag: A ‘tag’ is used for marking-up text in various ways.
Resize: Changing the size of something.
Rename: To change a word.
Symbol: A weird looking letter/number.
HEX Codes: A code for colors.
Process: A sequence.
Remain: To Stay.
Modify: To change.
Numerical: Numbered
Ordered: In order.
